alert.note: Alert for Evans; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 2:13PM EDT until further notice by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following counties, Bryan, Bulloch, Candler, Evans and Tattnall. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 210 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of slow moving thunderstorms extending from Collins and Jennie. These thunderstorms will drift north and impact portions of Tattnall, Evans, southern Bulloch and far northwest Bryan County. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claxton, Pembroke, Hagan, Collins, Pulaski, Register, Daisy, Bellville, Manassas, Nevils, Groveland, Denmark, Claxton Evans County Airport, Edna, Overbrook, Undine, Adabelle, New Hope, Jennie and Bay Branch.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
